0.title: Whenever we need them to score runs, they all get out: Kapil Dev on Rohit, Kohli, Rahul
0.article_body: Ex-India captain Kapil Dev criticised the approach of Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul in shortest format of the game. "All of these are players who can hit at...strike rate of 150-160. Whenever we need them to score runs...they all get out," Kapil said. He added, "The approach needs to change. And if it doesn't...you've to change the players."

1.title: China will lose 40% of people every generation at current birth rates: Musk
1.article_body:
The world’s richest person Elon Musk on Monday tweeted about a possible "population collapse" while sharing an article about China’s birth rate. Musk wrote, "Most people still think China has a one-child policy. China had its lowest birthdate ever last year, despite having a three-child policy!
At current birth rates, China will lose approximately 40% of people every generation!"

2.title: Warne said I wasn't needed, later said 'you're my man': Ex-RR pacer Tanveer
2.article_body: Sharing his experience while representing RR in IPL 2008 with the team led by Shane Warne, Pakistani pacer Sohail Tanveer said he was initially informed that Warne "didn't" need him. "I bowled well and picked up 2/26 [in a match]. After that...Warne came to me and said '[you're] my man'," added Tanvir. Tanvir won the purple cap in IPL 2008.

3.title: Prince Harry & Meghan share photo of Lilibet on her first birthday
3.article_body: UK's Prince Harry and wife Meghan Markle on Monday shared a picture of their daughter Lilibet celebrating her first birthday at a backyard picnic over the weekend. Lilibet Diana Mountbatten-Windsor was born in California and was named in honour of Queen Elizabeth II, whose family nickname has been Lilibet since she was a toddler. Lilibet is the Queen's 11th great-grandchild.

4.title: Mother jailed after 2-year-old son shoots father dead in US
4.article_body: A 28-year-old woman was jailed and is facing criminal charges after her two-year-old son shot his father dead in the US. The gun was not properly stored and was easily accessible even to a two-year-old, said Orange County Sheriff John Mina. "A young child has to live his life knowing he shot his father," Mina added.

5.title: Maldives welcomes BJP's action against Nupur Sharma over remarks on Prophet
5.article_body: The Maldives government has said it is "deeply concerned by the derogatory remarks made by some officials of BJP" on Prophet Muhammad. Maldives welcomed the "denouncement" by the Indian government of the remarks and the "prompt action taken by BJP against those officials".  BJP had suspended Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal over the remarks.

6.title: Candle flares bright before burning out: J&K LG on targeted killings
6.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha said religious leaders and the people of Kashmir are condemning the targeted killings of civilians in the Valley. "When a candle is about to burn out, its flame flares bright. This (militancy) is taking its last gasps," Sinha added. "They are unable to digest the arrival of so many tourists to the Valley," he stated.

7.title: Will respond swiftly & forcefully if N Korea holds nuclear test: US
7.article_body: US Deputy State Secretary Wendy Sherman said any nuclear test by North Korea would be "in complete violation of UN Security Council resolutions [and] there would be a swift and forceful response to such a test".  "I believe that not only South Korea...US and Japan but the entire world will respond in a strong and clear manner," she added.

8.title: Top Indian woman cyclist accuses coach of 'inappropriate behaviour' in Slovenia
8.article_body: A top Indian woman cyclist has accused the national sprint team chief coach R K Sharma of "inappropriate behaviour" during a camp in Slovenia, according to officials. The complainant was "immediately" brought back to India "to ensure her safety", Sports Authority of India said in a statement. Two separate inquiry committees have been formed to look into the allegation.

9.title: Ram Charan, wife Upasana celebrate driver's b'day, pics surface
9.article_body: 'RRR' actor Ram Charan celebrated his driver Naresh's birthday on Sunday, pictures of which have surfaced on social media. In the pictures, Charan and his wife Upasana Kamineni can be seen standing with Naresh, who was seen cutting the birthday cake. Charan is currently shooting for a film with director Shankar, which is tentatively titled 'RC15'.

10.title: Rajasthan BJP MLAs shifted to resort ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
10.article_body: The BJP shifted most of its MLAs in Rajasthan to a resort in the outskirts of Jaipur. This comes ahead of Rajya Sabha elections for four seats from the state, scheduled for June 10. Calling it a training camp, a party spokesperson said that the MLAs will be given training on the Rajya Sabha elections.

11.title: Muhammad Asif made me look like a very ordinary pacer: Shoaib Akhtar
11.article_body: Recalling the India-Pakistan 2006 Karachi Test, ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said, "The way [Muhammad] Asif trapped the Indian team...I have never seen [such] a magician. He made me look like a very ordinary [pacer]." Akhtar added Asif dismissed VVS Laxman in the exact same manner in both innings. Akhtar stated he was trying to "hurt" Sachin Tendulkar in the Test.

12.title: Delhi govt to open 100 more mohalla clinics across the city
12.article_body: At least 100 more Aam Aadmi Mohalla Clinics will be opened across the city, the Delhi government on Monday said. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia met with officials to review the progress of the project. The government will soon completely digitise the clinics and doctors will be able to track the medical history of patients to provide better treatment, Sisodia added.

13.title: Making law for population control won't serve any purpose: Bihar CM
13.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said making a law for population control won't serve any purpose. "Population control can only be achieved by educating women and girls. The fertility rate can be checked only through education and awareness," Kumar added. He cited China's instance where one-child policy was in effect for many years. "It has now changed...to two-child policy," Kumar stated.

14.title: Indian-origin Gupta brothers arrested in UAE over corruption charges
14.article_body: The South African government on Monday said two Indian-origin businessmen have been arrested in the UAE while accusing them of profiting from their close links with former President Jacob Zuma and exerting unfair influence. The brothers, Atul and Rajesh Gupta, have denied any wrongdoing. Meanwhile, South African officials said that their extradition talks are taking place with the UAE.

15.title: Bear kills MP couple; drags them to nullah, feeds on body parts for 4 hrs
15.article_body: A couple was killed by a bear in Madhya Pradesh on Sunday morning when the two were returning from a temple near their house. The victims reportedly died while trying to save each other from the bear. Eyewitnesses reportedly told police that the bear dragged them to a nullah and fed on their body parts for four hours.

16.title: Admissions closing soon for IIM-I & Jigsaw’s Business Analytics Program
16.article_body: After 12 batches, IIM Indore's online Business Analytics Program will begin its 13th cohort soon. 83% of learners enrolled in this 10-month program have transitioned in their careers, Jigsaw revealed. The program offers 5D framework-based curriculum, BYOP feature and Kaggle's In-Class competitions & modules in technologies like Big Data, Data Visualization & ML to help learners grasp the concepts.

17.title: Was asked for extra ticket for 'Dil...' in theatre, said 'I'm director': Ananth
17.article_body: Actor Ananth Narayan Mahadevan, who directed 'Dil Vil Pyar Vyar', said that he went to theatre to see reaction of the audience. "I had...the joy of someone coming and asking me, 'Do you have an extra ticket?' I told him, 'I don't need a ticket...I'm the director'. He got excited and said, 'Then you can get me tickets'," he added.

18.title: Ex-India cricketer Naman Ojha's father arrested in MP for cheating bank of ₹1.25 crore
18.article_body: VK Ojha, father of ex-India cricketer Naman Ojha, was arrested by police in MP's Betul district for allegedly cheating bank of ₹1.25 crore. Around 34 fake accounts were opened and KCC loan was transferred to accounts and a sum of ₹1.25 crore was withdrawn when VK Ojha was posted as manager of Bank of Maharashtra branch in 2013, police said.

19.title: India in talks to increase discounted Russian oil imports from Rosneft: Report
19.article_body: India is in talks to increase its Russian oil imports with state-owned Rosneft PJSC amid Western sanctions on Moscow over the Ukraine war, as per a report. It added that work is on to finalise a six-month supply contract for discounted Russian crude oil to India and that details on volumes and pricing are still being negotiated.

20.title: Fuel pump shut for selling petrol in bottles before Kanpur clashes
20.article_body: A fuel pump's licence was suspended after it was seen selling petrol in bottles, which is prohibited, in CCTV footage in Kanpur, said a district official. This comes amid violent clashes in the city over suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. A police officer said since petrol bombs were used, they tried to find the source.

21.title: Johnny Depp spends around $62,000 at Indian restaurant in UK to celebrate trial win
21.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp spent more than $62,000 for a special celebratory dinner with his friends at Indian restaurant 'Varanasi' in Birmingham  on Sunday to celebrate his defamation trial victory against his ex-wife Amber Heard. "The most talked about person on the planet right now joined us for dinner last night!" the restaurant wrote on Instagram, while sharing pictures.

22.title: Bomb threat issued to Lucknow, Unnao RSS offices; case registered
22.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police registered a case after a bomb threat to blow up Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) offices in Lucknow and Unnao was received on WhatsApp on Monday. An FIR was registered at Madiyaon Police Station in connection with the threat, police added. "With cyber cell's help, the number that sent the message will be traced," Lucknow Police said.

23.title: Dominican Republic Environment Min shot dead by friend in his office
23.article_body: The Dominican Republic's Environment Minister, Orlando Jorge Mera, was shot dead on Monday in his office by a close friend, the government said. Mera, son of former President Salvador Blanco, was shot by businessman Miguel Cruz, who was arrested at a church after telling a priest he committed a crime and handed over a gun to him, authorities said.

24.title: Sign naming road after Godse comes up in K'taka's Udupi; removed
24.article_body: Local officials and police have removed a signboard naming a road after Nathuram Godse, who had assassinated Mahatma Gandhi, in a village in Karnataka's Udupi following criticism. A panchayat officer said that no resolution had been passed for naming the road after Godse and a police complaint has been filed. Pictures and videos of the signboard had gone viral.

25.title: India reports 3,714 new COVID-19 cases, 2,513 recoveries in last 24 hours
25.article_body: India has reported 3,714 COVID-19 cases, 2,513 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 4,518 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 26,976, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,708, according to the latest data.

26.title: Viral video shows teacher sleeping in classroom as student blows fan in Bihar
26.article_body: A video showing a teacher sleeping in a classroom in Bihar's Bettiah has gone viral on social media. In the video, a student can be seen blowing a fan while the teacher is fast asleep. Reacting to the video, social media users wrote, "Bihar model of education," and "Welcome to Bihar."

27.title: I don't think I've made it in B'wood, have a lot to prove: Ahan Shetty
27.article_body: Actor Ahan Shetty, who made his Bollywood debut in 2021 with the film 'Tadap', said, "I don't think I've made it in the industry...I have a lot to prove." Ahan won the IIFA 2022 award for Best Debut Actor (Male) for his performance in 'Tadap'. "It's...special for me. I want to continue to work hard...continue to prove myself," he stated.

28.title: Christianity being spread across Punjab to weaken Sikhs: Akal Takht Jathedar
28.article_body: Akal Takht Jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh on Monday said Christianity is being spread across villages of Punjab to weaken Sikhs. "Sikhs are facing a lot of difficulties that are making us weak religiously, socially and economically," he added. "I appeal to all Sikhs, especially those in border areas to spread and strengthen Sikhism," Singh stated.

29.title: Man trying to sell leopard skin worth ₹10 lakh arrested in Bengaluru
29.article_body: A 30-year-old man, who was planning to sell leopard skin worth ₹10 lakh, was arrested in Bengaluru on Monday. Acting on a tip-off, a police team posing as customers, approached the accused, identified as Dhanraj, and arrested him. The police also seized ganja worth ₹8,000 from him. According to police, Dhanraj has several criminal cases pending against him.

30.title: An error, statement made under provocation: Jethmalani on Nupur’s remarks
30.article_body: Reacting to former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma’s controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Rajya Sabha MP Mahesh Jethmalani said it was an "insensitive statement made under provocation", which she has regretted. "The real fringe are those who on public platforms stoke fire created by her error and ruin GoI's efforts to repair the damage and restore India's image abroad," he tweeted.

31.title: Car parking lift collapses in 23-storey building near Mumbai, 4 injured
31.article_body: Four people were injured after a car parking lift collapsed in a 23-storey building in Kalyan, near Mumbai. Reports said that the incident took place when repair work was being done and the lift was being tested. Police said that the building has a four-storey car parking facility and that the cause of the collapse will be checked.

32.title: BMTC to run 10 buses from newly-opened Visvesvaraya rail terminal
32.article_body: The Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) has decided to operate 10 buses from the newly-opened Sir M Visvesvaraya terminal at the Byappanahalli railway station. The buses will make 144 trips a day, connecting the Visvesvaraya terminal to Channasandra, Central Silk Board, Banaswadi, Subbaiahnapalya, Nagawara and Munnekolalu Cross, said BMTC in a statement.

33.title: Staffer peeps at woman taking a bath at hospital in Pune; booked
33.article_body: Pune police have booked a 25-year-old staffer who works at a hospital in the city on charges of voyeurism and stalking after he allegedly peeped at a woman who was taking a bath there. The woman, who is a relative of a patient, approached hospital authorities and police but the suspect had fled by then, according to a police official.

34.title: 2 more minors raped in Hyderabad, number rises to 5 in a week
34.article_body: Two more rape cases involving minors were reported in Hyderabad on Monday, taking the total to five in a week. In the first case, a 17-year-old girl was lured and raped by a 23-year-old man, whereas in another case, the victim was sexually assaulted at a movie theatre. The accused in both the cases have been arrested, police said.

35.title: Auto driver molests 17-yr-old girl, bites her after she resists in Pune
35.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver allegedly molested a 17-year-old girl and bit her when she resisted in Pune, police said. She had taken the auto to go home but the driver took her to a secluded place, allegedly hugged her forcibly and also touched her inappropriately, police added. Two passers-by heard the girl screaming for help and rushed towards her, police stated.

36.title: Man in drunk state drowns during pool party in Gurugram; 4 booked
36.article_body: A 33-year-old man from Delhi allegedly drowned in a swimming pool in an inebriated state during a party in a village in Gurugram, police said on Monday. Three of the deceased's friends and the pool owner were booked for negligence causing death, ACP (DLF) Sanjeev Kumar said. The deceased's brother claimed that the man's friends had assaulted and killed him.

37.title: Bombay HC ends POCSO case as victim, now 18+, & accused decide to marry
37.article_body: Bombay High Court has quashed FIR under Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act for penetrative sexual assault, after victim, who is now reportedly above 18 years of age, said she and the accused were in love and are now to be married. The bench noted if prosecution still remains, it will come in way of their peaceful life.

38.title: Ex-Punjab Minister and Cong leader Sadhu Singh Dharamsot held in corruption case
38.article_body: Punjab's former Forest Minister and Congress leader, Sadhu Singh Dharamsot, was arrested by Vigilance Bureau (VB) in a corruption case. A local journalist who was allegedly working as an aide was also arrested. This comes after VB arrested Mohali Divisional Forest Officer over graft charges. He disclosed to VB how Dharamsot used to be bribed before cutting a single tree.

39.title: Expected critics to rip 'Om...' apart, glowing reviews shocked me: Farah
39.article_body: Talking about her 2007 film 'Om Shanti Om' starring Shah Rukh Khan, director Farah Khan said, "I was prepared for the fact that the critics would rip it apart as it was crazier than 'Main Hoon Na'." "We showed Shah Rukh fighting with a stuffed tiger and what not!...I was...[shocked] that it got such glowing reviews," added Farah.

40.title: Steve Harvey confirms daughter Lori Harvey and Michael B Jordan's breakup
40.article_body: American TV host Steve Harvey confirmed his daughter Lori Harvey and actor Michael B Jordan's breakup. "I still gotta go to work...I still gotta take care of my family. I'm team Lori...1000%," he said. Steve added, "[Michael] is still a cool guy...from what I know. It's a breakup. I'm pretty sure they'll be fine. People break up all the time."

41.title: Bengaluru makes masks must in public places amid COVID-19 spike
41.article_body: Bengaluru's municipal body BBMP on Monday made wearing masks mandatory in public places. This comes amid a spike in COVID-19 cases. "Everyday, more than 200 new COVID-19 cases are being reported and we are conducting 16,000 tests," said BBMP official Dr Harish Kumar. The number of daily tests by BBMP will be increased to 20,000, he added.

42.title: Don't call us pro-China, we're pro-US: Taiwan's opposition party
42.article_body: Taiwan's main opposition party chief Eric Chu said it's wrong to label the Kuomintang (KMT) party as being pro-China as it has always been pro-US. However, he added that the party is also dedicated to defending the island by talking to Beijing. KMT party ruled China until fleeing to Taiwan in 1949 after losing a civil war to the Communists.

43.title: Saudi man offers to marry Amber Heard after she loses defamation case against Johnny Depp
43.article_body: A man from Saudi Arabia has offered to marry actress Amber Heard after she lost a defamation case against her ex-husband Johnny Depp. "Amber...since all doors are closing on you, you have no one except me to take care of you," the man said in a voice note circulating online. "I am better than that old man," he added.

44.title: I started diverting all my endorsements to charity work: Sonu Sood
44.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood revealed that he started diverting all the endorsements he did to charity work and education. "With steel brands, I started making houses, with light brands I started lighting villages...and when I did mobile brands, I started donating mobiles," he stated. "I'm educating thousands of kids in tie-up with universities, I did free endorsements for them," he added.

45.title: 17-yr-old boy found dead with stab injury in abdomen in Delhi
45.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was found dead with a stab injury in his abdomen on HR road near Ramjas School in Delhi's Anand Parbat area on Monday, police said. "We got a call at 7.15 am...regarding an unknown person lying dead on HR road," DCP (Central) Shweta Chauhan said. "No eyewitness was found... [but] a case of murder has been registered," she added.

46.title: US rapper Trouble shot dead at female friend's apartment
46.article_body: US rapper Trouble, who collaborated with Drake and The Weeknd in his career, was shot dead at a female friend's apartment in Georgia. The police have issued an arrest warrant for 33-year-old Jamichael Jones. Police said Jones and Trouble were not known to each other, but that Jones was involved in a "domestic situation" with the woman Trouble was visiting.

47.title: ED files 1st charge sheet against Choksi's wife, calls her 'ultimate beneficiary'
47.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has filed its first charge sheet against fugitive Mehul Choksi's wife Priti Choksi in the ₹13,000 crore PNB fraud case, stating that she was "hand in glove with her husband" and was the "ultimate beneficial owner". Called "abettor of the crime", the fresh money laundering charges against Priti will allow agencies to pursue her extradition from Antigua.

48.title: UK PM Boris Johnson wins no-confidence vote
48.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson has won the no-confidence motion brought in the country's Parliament over the 'partygate' scandal. Johnson got 211 lawmakers' support while 148 MPs of his Conservative Party voted against him. The vote was triggered after at least 54 MPs from Conservative Party submitted letters of no confidence to the Chair of the 1922 Committee of backbench lawmakers.

49.title: Apple introduces macOS Ventura with new tools & updates on Safari
49.article_body: Apple has previewed macOS Ventura desktop operating system with several new tools, like the Stage Manager, which lets users group windows and switch quickly between apps. Safari has added the Shared Tabs Group feature which will let users share a set of open tabs with their friends. Safari has also been enabled to use the more secure FIDO Alliance-supported passkeys.

50.title: Apple announces new MacBooks with M2 chip starting from $1,199
50.article_body: Apple has announced new MacBook Air and MacBook Pro with the M2 chip, which will include 25% more transistors and 50% more bandwidth than the M1. Apple said it's focused on power-efficient performance, maximising speed performance while limiting the amount of power needed to do so. MacBook Air with M2 starts at $1,199, while the MacBook Pro starts at $1,299.

51.title: Apple iOS16 adds 'Safety Check' feature to help people in abusive relationships
51.article_body: Apple's iOS16 unveiled on Monday will have a new feature called 'Safety Check' to help people in abusive relationships by revoking shared device access with their partners. It will stop location sharing, reset privacy settings and protect messages from the abusive partner. Apple unveiled updates to the 'My Home' app and a new protocol for smart home devices called 'Matter'.

52.title: Apple unveils iOS 16 with updated Lock Screen, adds 'Undo' feature for sent Messages
52.article_body: Apple on Monday unveiled iOS 16, which includes an updated Lock Screen that can be completely customised with widgets. The Lock Screen will also get a new 'Live screen' activity feature. The new iOS has also upgraded Messages app that will let users undo sent messages or edit messages after sending them.

53.title: Have a great year ahead: Tendulkar to Rahane on his 34th birthday
53.article_body: Taking to Twitter to wish India batter Ajinkya Rahane on his 34th birthday, Sachin Tendulkar wrote, "Wishing you a very happy birthday Ajinkya. Have a great year ahead." Rahane, who made his debut for India in August 2011, has so far scored 8,268 runs across all international formats. Rahane last played in a Test against South Africa in January 2022.

54.title: Who is Radhika Merchant, Mukesh & Nita Ambani's son Anant's fiancee?
54.article_body: Mukesh and Nita Ambani on Sunday hosted an Arangetram event for Radhika Merchant, who is engaged to their son Anant Ambani. She is the daughter of billionaire Viren Merchant, the CEO of the pharma company Encore Healthcare. She studied politics and economics during her undergraduate from New York University and completed her Bharatanatyam training under Guru Bhavana Thakar.

55.title: This happens in our industry: Kuku on extra-marital affair with Aruna
55.article_body: Director-producer Sandeep Kohli, known as Kuku Kohli, has spoken about his extra-marital affair with veteran actress Aruna Irani, saying that such things happen in the industry. He added that the two live together. On being asked if his daughters have accepted the veteran actress as family, he said, "Aisa kabhi mauka hi nahi aaya (The opportunity never came up only)."

56.title: It's like he came to say goodbye: Gulzar on KK's last recorded song
56.article_body: After late singer KK's last recorded song 'Dhoop Paani Bahne De' was released, veteran lyricist Gulzar said, "It's like he came to say goodbye." Gulzar further said, "When he came to sing the song for 'Sherdil', it filled my heart with joy. It's a shame that this had to go down as one of his last songs."

57.title: Been tough 2 weeks but also exhilarating: Nadal on 14th French Open win
57.article_body: Reflecting on the past two weeks in Paris following his record-extending 14th French Open title, world number four Rafael Nadal said it has been "tough", but it's also been very "exhilarating". He added, "Very pleased, obviously. I'm happy...And I'll be leaving here with an unforgettable memory." Overall, it was Nadal's 22nd Grand Slam title win on Sunday.

58.title: Russian authorities put investigative journalist on wanted list
58.article_body: Investigative journalist Andrei Soldatov on Monday said that Russian authorities had placed him on a wanted list and frozen his bank accounts. Soldatov is known for his coverage of Russian security agencies. Soldatov claimed the case against him had been filed in a manner similar to that of two journalists accused of spreading "fake information" about Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

59.title: I'm silent, not sick: Dharmendra in video refuting hospitalisation rumours
59.article_body: Actor Dharmendra shared a video denying rumours of him being hospitalised in a 'critical' condition as was reported earlier. "Main chup hu, lekin beemaar nahi (I'm silent but not sick)," said the 86-year-old veteran actor. "Be positive, think positive, life will be positive," said Dharmendra in the video. He was hospitalised last month following a muscle spasm.

60.title: Man kills wife, daughters aged 2 & 3 with stone in Rajasthan
60.article_body: A 35-year-old man allegedly killed his wife and two daughters, aged two and three years, by hitting them with a heavy stone after a domestic issue at a village in Rajasthan's Udaipur district. The man then ran away, police said. The couple's eight-year-old son was also present on the spot and he rushed to his grandparents' house to inform them.

61.title: I had to do Deepika's 'Bajirao Mastani' scene in audition: Manushi
61.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar has said that she was given a scene from actress Deepika Padukone's 2015 film 'Bajirao Mastani' for her audition. She called the audition "most intense and challenging", adding that the call after the audition confirming her role was validation that she could chase her dreams in Bollywood. Manushi made her Bollywood debut in Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj'.

62.title: NATO kicks off drills with Finland, Sweden amid tensions with Russia
62.article_body: NATO on Sunday kicked off a two-week military exercise with Finland and Sweden in the Baltic Sea amid tensions with Russia over the war in Ukraine. Notably, Finland and Sweden had applied to join NATO in May. Russia had warned the two countries against joining the Western military alliance and warned them of retaliatory measures against the move.

63.title: Happy to see how my nephew Nadal is totally normal guy despite success: Toni
63.article_body: Praising nephew Rafael Nadal, his uncle and ex-coach Toni Nadal said he's happy to see how the 36-year-old is a "totally normal guy", who plays good tennis and hasn't changed despite having a successful career. Nadal recently won his 22nd Grand Slam title, an all-time men's record, at French Open. Toni is currently part of Canadian Felix Auger-Aliassime's coaching team.

64.title: Delhi law student held for intentionally hitting biker with Scorpio car
64.article_body: A 25-year-old final-year law student from Delhi has been arrested after a video purportedly showed him speeding away after hitting a 22-year-old biker with his Scorpio car. The biker has claimed that the accused, who got into an argument with him, verbally abused and threatened him before intentionally hitting his bike. The law student's car has been seized.

65.title: Jailed leader Navjot Singh Sidhu hospitalised due to liver problems
65.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, who was lodged in Patiala central jail, has been hospitalised due to liver-related problems, Chandigarh's PGIMER said. The hospital said that he required further evaluation and his condition is stable. Sidhu was last month sentenced to one year in jail over a 1988 road rage case that led to a man's death.

66.title: Fire at container depot in Bangladesh continues for 3rd day
66.article_body: A fire that left 41 people dead at a container depot in Bangladesh's Chittagong has continued to burn for the third day on Monday. Officials warned that there is a risk of further blasts if the flames spread to chemicals stored nearby. An official said that a container with hydrogen peroxide was identified as the possible source of the fire.

67.title: Will finish my term, won't run for re-election: Sri Lankan Prez
67.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday said that he will complete the remaining two years of his term but won't contest again, Bloomberg reported. "I can't go as a failed president...I have been given a mandate for five years," he said. His comments come as anti-government protesters have been demanding his ouster amid country's worst economic crisis since independence.

68.title: Teenage MP girl, uncle paraded with garlands of shoes for eloping; 8 held
68.article_body: A 17-year-old girl and her 48-year-old maternal uncle were allegedly abused and paraded with garlands of shoes around their necks in a village in Madhya Pradesh as punishment for eloping, police said. A case was registered and eight persons were arrested in this connection. The villagers allegedly abused the duo for the "immoral" act, police added, while quoting the FIR.

69.title: I started doing wicketkeeping as my father was a wicketkeeper too: Pant
69.article_body: Revealing how he became a wicketkeeper-batter, Rishabh Pant said, "As a kid, I started doing wicketkeeping because my father was a wicketkeeper too." The India wicketkeeper-batter added, "I have no idea if my wicketkeeping has got better or not, I am just trying to give my 100 percent every single day. I was always a wicketkeeper-batter."

70.title: Brazil begins talks with IAEA on nuclear fuel for planned submarine
70.article_body: International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) chief Rafael Grossi on Monday said that Brazil has initiated discussions with the UN watchdog aimed at eventually allowing it to use nuclear fuel in a submarine. Brazil plans to acquire a nuclear-powered submarine under a contract with a French company. Notably, nuclear-powered submarines can remain underwater and at sea for longer than other submarines.

71.title: Nuclear-capable ballistic missile Agni-4 successfully tested from Odisha
71.article_body: India successfully carried out a training launch of nuclear-capable intermediate-range ballistic missile Agni-4 from Odisha's APJ Abdul Kalam Island on Monday, the Defence Ministry said. "The successful test reaffirms India's policy of having a credible minimum deterrence capability," it added. The test is part of routine user training launches carried out under Strategic Forces Command's aegis.

72.title: Want to inculcate Dhoni's calmness, self-belief: SA all-rounder Pretorius
72.article_body: Ahead of India-South Africa five-match T20I series, South Africa all-rounder Dwaine Pretorius said he'll try to bring MS Dhoni's calmness and self-belief into his game. Pretorius made his IPL debut for Dhoni-led CSK this year. On the upcoming series, Pretorius said, "Performances in this series is going to go far to secure a spot in the [T20] World Cup."

73.title: Why is UK PM Johnson facing a no-confidence vote today?
73.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson faces a no-confidence vote in the Parliament on Monday over the 'partygate' scandal. A video of Johnson's senior aides joking about breaking lockdown rules to attend a Christmas party was leaked online in December 2021. Parties involving alcohol were allegedly held in Downing Street during the height of COVID-19 lockdowns in 2020 and 2021.

74.title: England Test captaincy had become very unhealthy relationship: Root
74.article_body: Speaking about England Test captaincy, Joe Root stated it had become a "very unhealthy relationship", adding it was taking a bad toll on his personal health. "I couldn't leave it at...ground any more; it was coming home," Root said. Root, who was replaced by Ben Stokes, led England in 64 Tests, winning 27 and losing 26 during his five-year tenure.

75.title: 20-year-old man arrested for 'needle attacks' in France
75.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested in southern France on Sunday after being accused of attacking people with needles. The accused was charged two days after 20 people reported needle injuries during the filming of a televised concert in Toulon. As many as 100 incidents of 'needle injuries' at French nightclubs and festivals have been reported since beginning of this year.

76.title: It's time to send an IAS officer to jail: High Court on officials not obeying orders
76.article_body: Karnataka High Court expressed displeasure over government officials not following court orders and observed, "It's time an IAS officer is sent to jail." It also observed that officers were not taking court orders seriously. The court said this after the state government failed to implement a July, 2021 court order regarding merging of Group-C with Group-B jobs in municipalities.

77.title: I was asked to have no expression for passport photo: Shabana Azmi
77.article_body: Actor Farhan Akhtar on Monday shared a picture of himself smiling on social media along with the caption, "Too smiley for a passport photo I was told." His step-mother veteran actress Shabana Azmi commented on the post, writing, "I was asked to have no expression for my passport photo and replied I'm an actress I can't be expressionless!!!"

78.title: Sri Lankan minister convicted of extortion, gets suspended sentence
78.article_body: Sri Lankan Cabinet minister Prasanna Ranatunga has been convicted of extorting money from a businessman over a land deal on Monday. Ranatunga, the younger brother of Sri Lankan cricketer Arjuna Ranatunga, was given two-year suspended prison sentence and fined 25 million Sri Lankan rupees. He was asked to pay one million Sri Lankan rupees as compensation to the businessman.

79.title: China's Beijing reopens restaurants amid declining COVID-19 cases
79.article_body: Beijing on Monday reopened restaurants for the first time in over a month amid declining COVID-19 cases in China's national capital. Museums, cinemas and gyms will be allowed to operate at up to 75% of capacity and delivery drivers will be able to bring packages to a customer's door. Authorities had conducted multiple rounds of mass testing during the outbreak.

80.title: Scorpio driver who hit biker & ran away in Delhi booked
80.article_body: The driver of the Mahindra Scorpio who rammed the car into a biker in South Delhi's Arjan Garh has been booked, police said.  A video of the car hitting the biker and speeding away went viral on social media on Sunday. The biker alleged that the driver verbally abused and threatened him before hitting the bike.

81.title: Anupam Kher meets UP CM Yogi Adityanath at his residence, shares pics
81.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher met Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath at his official residence in Lucknow and shared pictures from the meeting on social media on Monday. The actor wrote, "The stories of your early life were very entertaining and interesting as well as inspiring. You are a source of energy for us and for every generation of the country."

82.title: 'Do you use makeup', journalist asks world No 1 Iga after French Open, fans react
82.article_body: World No 1 tennis player Iga Swiatek was asked by a journalist, "When you go to a party, do you use makeup?" after Swiatek clinched her second French Open title. She replied, "I don't wear makeup...I don't feel like I...have to." A fan said, "The reporter...should be banned from WTA events". "Can't wait to hear Rafa's answer," said another.

83.title: DNA test ordered on 'stolen' buffalo to settle ownership fight in UP
83.article_body: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli has ordered a buffalo's DNA test after a labourer, who complained that the animal was stolen from his shed in 2020, traced it to another village. The alleged new owner claimed the buffalo belongs to him. Shamli SP said the test was ordered as the labourer claimed to have the buffalo's mother in his possession.

84.title: UAE condemns ex-BJP leader's remarks against Prophet, says 'respect religious symbols'
84.article_body: The UAE on Monday released a statement, condemning former BJP leader's remarks against Prophet Muhammad. "The Ministry underscored the need to respect religious symbols and not violate them, as well as confront hate speech and violence," the UAE's Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation stated. BJP had suspended Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal over their remarks.

85.title: We condemn offensive statements by BJP official against Prophet: Oman to India
85.article_body: Oman has released a statement saying that it summoned Indian ambassador and "expressing to him the Sultanate of Oman's condemnation of the offensive statements of the Prophet...issued by a BJP official". It also welcomed BJP's decision to suspend the BJP leader. Earlier, Qatar, Iran and Kuwait summoned the Indian envoy over the remarks.

86.title: My happiness won't change 1% if Novak wins 23 Slams and I stay at 22: Nadal
86.article_body: World number four Rafael Nadal, who won his 22nd Grand Slam at recently concluded French Open, said he won't be bothered if Novak Djokovic wins 23 Slams and he stays at 22. "My happiness will not change at all. Not even one percent," he added. Nadal further said that breaking his tally of 14 French Open titles will be "difficult".

87.title: 90% of land acquisition for bullet train project completed: NHSRCL
87.article_body: National High Speed Rail Corporation Limited (NHSRCL) on Monday said that over 90% of the land required for the Ahmedabad-Mumbai bullet train project has been acquired. NHSRCL also said that 98.79% of the land required in Gujarat has been acquired, while the figure stands at 71.49% in Maharashtra. The land required in Dadra and Nagar Haveli has been fully acquired.

88.title: Maybe I'll take prince: Kartik Aaryan on being called 'king' like SRK
88.article_body: On being called 'king of monologues' and 'king of masses' when only Shah Rukh Khan holds the title 'King of Bollywood', Kartik Aaryan said, "Maybe I'll take prince." The actor further said he doesn't want to accept the term 'king' since he still has a long way to go. "I think I'm just happy with all the love," he added.

89.title: Sable breaks national record in 3000m steeplechase for 8th time in Rabat
89.article_body: India's Avinash Sable broke his own 3000m steeplechase national record after he finished fifth in the race at Rabat Diamond League 2022 in Morocco on Sunday. The 27-year-old, in his maiden Diamond League appearance, clocked 8:12.48. This is the eighth time Sable broke the national record. Tokyo Olympic gold medallist Soufiane El Bakkali of Morocco won the race in 7:58.28.

90.title: China bans tattoos for minors, says they oppose 'socialist values'
90.article_body: China on Monday banned individuals aged below 18 from getting tattoos, stating that body art for minors opposes "socialist core values". According to the new rules, tattoo artists and parlours found to be tattooing minors will be strictly punished as per law. Additionally, no advertisement, books, journals or digital publications can include content that could influence minors to get tattoos.

91.title: Mumbai's daily COVID-19 cases fall to 676; positivity rate at 9.8%
91.article_body: Mumbai on Monday reported 676 new COVID-19 cases, compared to 961 cases recorded on Sunday. The positivity rate dropped to 9.8% from Sunday's 10.94%. The city saw 318 recoveries in the last 24 hours, while the number of active cases stands at 5,238. The overall growth rate of COVID-19 cases in Mumbai between May 30 and June 5 was 0.066%.

92.title: Amber gets proposal from Saudi man, he says he's better than Depp
92.article_body: Actress Amber Heard has received a marriage proposal from a Saudi Arabian man after losing the defamation trial by ex-husband Johnny Depp. The man says in a voice note sent to Amber's Instagram account, "You have no one except me to take care of you...some people hate and bully you...[I've] decided to marry you...I'm better than that old man (Depp)."

93.title: Lawrence Bishnoi questioned amid reports of 'LB' initials on threat letter to Salman
93.article_body: Jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi was questioned on Monday in connection to a threat letter sent to Salman Khan and his father Salim Khan. This came as reports said today that the letter had the initials 'LB' signed on it. Letter also reportedly had 'GB', seen as a reference to Bishnoi's aide Goldy Brar, who's an accused in Sidhu Moosewala's murder.

94.title: BJP's bigotry damaged India's position: Rahul on Prophet remark row
94.article_body: Rahul Gandhi on Monday criticised BJP for its "shameless bigotry" amid the Prophet remark row, stating that BJP has not only isolated India but also damaged its global position. He added that India's internal division had weakened country externally. Gandhi's remarks came as countries including Qatar and Kuwait summoned Indian envoys over ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's comments on Prophet Muhammad.

95.title: Who are the ICC Player of the Month nominees for May?
95.article_body: The ICC on Monday announced the Player of the Month nominees for the month of May. Sri Lanka's Angelo Mathews and Asitha Fernando, and Bangladesh's Mushfiqur Rahim have been nominated for ICC Men's Player of the Month award, while Pakistan's Tuba Hassan and Bismah Maroof, and Jersey's Trinity Smith have been nominated in the women's category.

96.title: AAP is the only antidote to BJP: Kejriwal at 'Tiranga Yatra' in Gujarat
96.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal held a 'Tiranga Yatra' in Gujarat's Mehsana on Monday, ahead of the state Assembly elections. "People are scared to say anything against BJP. AAP is the only antidote...Gujarat wants change," Kejriwal added. AAP will be contesting the polls on all 182 seats in the state.

97.title: How much prize money has Rafael Nadal won in his tennis career?
97.article_body: Rafael Nadal won his 22nd singles Grand Slam on Sunday after winning the French Open for the 14th time. The 36-year-old Spaniard has won 92 singles titles and 11 doubles titles so far. In 2022, he has won four singles' titles, bagging a prize money of $5,718,607. Overall, Nadal has won a prize money of $130,681,472 in his career.

98.title: Helicopter bounces & turns 270 degrees while landing in Kedarnath; video surfaces
98.article_body: A private aviation company's helicopter bounced and turned 270 degrees while landing at a helipad in Kedarnath last week. A video of the incident has also surfaced online, following which Directorate General of Civil Aviation launched a probe into the incident. DGCA also issued an operational advisory, stating, "Pilots are to exercise caution for presence of any tailwinds during approaches."

99.title: It was like climbing Mt Everest for 1st time: Gavaskar on reaching 10,000 Test runs
99.article_body: Recalling the moment when he became the first cricketer to reach 10,000 Test runs, Sunil Gavaskar said, "[It was] magical because it hadn't been done before." He added, "Even 9,000 hadn't been done before, and I did it. But 9,000 is a four-digit number. 10,000 is a five-digit number...so it was almost like climbing Mt Everest for the first time."

100.title: U'khand board declares Class 10 & 12 results; Diya Rajput tops Class 12 with 97%
100.article_body: The Uttarakhand Board of School Education released the Class 10 and 12 board results on Monday. Diya Rajput topped Class 12 with 97% marks, while Mukul Silswal secured the first position in Class 10 with 99% marks. The overall pass percentage in Class 12 is 82.63%, while it is 77.74% in Class 10.

101.title: Lebanon invites US envoy to help end maritime dispute with Israel
101.article_body: The Lebanese government on Monday invited a US envoy to work out an agreement amid rising tensions between Lebanon and Israel over a maritime border dispute. This comes after Israel sent a natural gas storage and production ship to the disputed waters. On Sunday, Lebanon warned Israel not to start drilling in the Karish field.

102.title: 50 kg heroin found floating in sea days after Pak boat crew's arrest in Guj
102.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) and marine police have seized 50 kilograms of heroin worth ₹250 crore packed in plastic packets found floating in the sea off the Jakhau coast in Gujarat's Kutch district. Officials said the discovery came five days after seven Pakistani nationals on a boat were arrested in the Indian waters off the Gujarat coast.

103.title: Iraq sentences UK man to 15 yrs in jail for smuggling artefacts
103.article_body: An Iraqi court on Monday sentenced a 66-year-old British geologist to 15 years in prison for trying to smuggle ancient artefacts out of country "with criminal intent". Iraqi authorities had arrested James Fitton at Baghdad International Airport in March for carrying fragments of pottery in his luggage. The pottery fragments were reportedly taken from a heritage site in southern Iraq.

104.title: My mother would say, 'khel, tod': Umran on breaking windows growing up while playing
104.article_body: Fast bowler Umran Malik, in a recent interview, said that he loved fast bowling from the beginning. "When I was young, I would play with a plastic ball at home and would get scolded for breaking glass windows. But even then, my mother would not stop me from playing and would say, 'khel, tod' (Play, break)," he stated.

105.title: Salah rejected X-ray, played AFCON qualifier with injury: Egypt manager
105.article_body: Egypt manager Ehab Galal has revealed Mohamed Salah played through injury in their 1-0 Africa Cup of Nations qualifying victory against Guinea on Sunday, having "rejected Liverpool's request" for an X-ray. "He...will now undergo it," he added. Despite his injury, Salah played entire 90 minutes. Salah has been struggling with a groin problem he picked up in FA Cup final.

106.title: Musk warns Twitter he'll terminate $44 bn deal if fake accounts data not given
106.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has written a letter to Twitter saying the company is "actively resisting and thwarting" his right to information about fake accounts on the platform. This is a "clear material breach" of Twitter's obligations under the $44 billion merger deal, he wrote. Musk further said he reserves all rights to terminate the deal to acquire Twitter.

107.title: Mumbai Police to summon Nupur Sharma over her remarks on Prophet
107.article_body: Mumbai Police will soon send a summon to suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma and record her statement in connection with her alleged comments against Prophet Muhammad, Mumbai Police chief Sanjay Pandey said. The city police had last week registered an FIR against Sharma in this connection. She allegedly made the remarks during a television debate.

108.title: 16-year-old girl forced to sell her eggs 8 times by mother, her boyfriend in TN
108.article_body: A woman, along with two others, has been arrested for allegedly forcing her 16-year-old daughter to sell her eggs eight times at a private fertility clinic in Tamil Nadu's Erode. The woman and her boyfriend allegedly forced the victim to sell the eggs after she hit puberty at the age of 12. The couple reportedly received ₹20,000 for each egg.

109.title: Blocking my plane from reaching Serbia unprecedented: Lavrov
109.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov has termed Bulgaria, North Macedonia and Montenegro's move to close their airspace to block his plane from travelling to Serbia an "unprecedented" move. Lavrov said he hasn't received any explanation for the decision yet, adding that he'll invite his Serbian counterpart to Moscow. Notably, Bulgaria, North Macedonia and Montenegro are NATO member countries.

110.title: Trainee pilot injured as aircraft crashes while landing at Odisha airstrip
110.article_body: A trainee pilot sustained critical injuries after an aircraft went out of the runway while landing and crashed at the Birasal airstrip in Odisha's Dhenkanal on Monday. The Cessna 152 aircraft belongs to Government Aviation Training Institute (GATI). The student has been taken to a hospital and the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has started an investigation, officials said.

111.title: We're trying to create our own Marvel with 'Brahmāstra': Ranbir
111.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has stated that they have the opportunity to create India's own Marvel with 'Brahmāstra', adding director Ayan Mukerji is trying to do this with his Astraverse. "It's deep-rooted in Indian culture...'Brahmāstra' is not an end in itself but...a means to a larger end," the actor added. He further said that they have three parts ahead of them.

112.title: I've learned a lot from how Root went about his game in SL: Labuschagne
112.article_body: Talking about playing his first Test in Sri Lanka on a spin-friendly pitch, Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne said it's about conquering that challenge. "Joe Root played phenomenally over there, I've learned a lot from how he went about his game there," he added. Root scored 228, 1, 186, 11 in January 2021. Sri Lanka-Australia will play two Tests in Galle.

113.title: Honey Singh pays tribute to Sidhu Moosewala, does his signature step at concert
113.article_body: Rapper Yo Yo Honey Singh paid tribute to Sidhu Moosewala during a concert in Mumbai on Sunday. In a video that has surfaced online, Honey Singh could be seen doing Moosewala's signature step on stage, with the late singer's song 'Uchiyan Ne Gallan Tere Yaar Diya' playing in the background. Moosewala was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa on May 29.

114.title: Salman to fly to Hyd for 'Kabhi Eid...' schedule amid threat: Report
114.article_body: Actor Salman Khan will be flying to Hyderabad for the next schedule of his film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali' amid the threat letter received by him and his father Salim Khan, reported ETimes. As per the report, Salman will be shooting in Hyderabad for 25 days after which he will return to Mumbai to join the 'Tiger 3' schedule.

115.title: President Ram Nath Kovind to visit Bengaluru on June 13
115.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind will visit Bengaluru on June 13, on a two-day official visit to Karnataka. The President will participate in the platinum jubilee celebrations of the Rashtriya Military School and stay at the Raj Bhavan during the night, as per the itinerary. He will leave for Delhi on June 14.

116.title: 4 men rob businessman on Western Express Highway in Mumbai
116.article_body: Four men were arrested for robbing a businessman of his phone and a gold chain on the Western Express Highway (WEH) in Mumbai, a police official said on Monday. The incident had taken place on May 25, the official added. The police had scanned CCTV footages to find the accused, who had intercepted the businessman's car in a cab.

117.title: Entry of Hindi has divided people in south: TN MP on 'Shudra' remark
117.article_body: Tamil Nadu MP TKS Elangovan, who earlier stated that Hindi imposition will denote Tamilians as 'Shudras', stated that "entry of" Hindi has divided people in southern India. "What I [meant] was that [usage of] Hindi...may bring...cultural practice...enforced in the north to us...It'll confirm our Shudra class," he said. Elangovan had earlier claimed that Hindi is spoken in "underdeveloped states".

118.title: Kuwait supermarkets remove Indian products over ex-BJP leader's remarks on Prophet
118.article_body: Supermarkets in Kuwait have removed Indian products from their shelves in protest against former BJP leader's remarks against Prophet Muhammad. A video showed workers at Al-Ardiya Co-Operative Society store covering or removing the products lined up on the shelves. "We, as a Kuwaiti Muslim people, do not accept insulting the Prophet," Nasser Al-Mutairi, CEO of the store, said.

119.title: Disneyland staff interrupts marriage proposal, Disney apologises as video goes viral
119.article_body: Disney apologised after a video of a marriage proposal being interrupted by a Disneyland Paris employee went viral. The employee is seen grabbing the ring from the hands of a man while he's proposing and telling the couple to get down from the platform they were on. "We regret how this was handled...and offered to make it right," said Disney.

120.title: You deserve this and so much more: Sunny on Sharvari's IIFA win
120.article_body: Actor Sunny Kaushal took to Instagram Stories to congratulate his rumoured girlfriend actress Sharvari Wagh for winning Star Debut of the Year at the 2022 IIFA Awards. He wrote along with her picture, "Couldn't be prouder Sharu! You deserve this and so so sooo much more! Congratulations Sharvari. Big tight hug." Sharvari won the award for 'Bunty Aur Babli 2'.

121.title: Railways doubles ticket booking limit on IRCTC, users can book up to 24 tickets per month
121.article_body: Indian Railways has doubled online ticket booking limit through IRCTC website and app. An Aadhaar-linked user ID can now book up to 24 tickets in a month instead of 12, provided that one of the passengers should be verifiable through Aadhaar. A user ID which is not linked with Aadhaar can book up to 12 tickets in a month.

122.title: 2006 Varanasi serial blasts convict Waliullah Khan gets death penalty
122.article_body: Terrorist Waliullah Khan, who was convicted in the 2006 Varanasi serial blasts case, has been awarded death penalty and life imprisonment. At least 20 people were killed and over 100 others were injured in the blasts at Sankat Mochan temple and cantonment railway station on March 7, 2006. The Allahabad High Court had transferred the case to Ghaziabad district court.

123.title: World's biggest 4-day work week trial with no loss of salary begins in UK
123.article_body: The world's biggest trial of four-day work week is set to begin in the UK on Monday, with more than 70 companies and 3,300 employees. The trial will not result in any loss of pay for employees. It is based on the 100:80:100 model, implying that employees will get 100% of pay for 80% of time and maintain 100% productivity.

124.title: U'khand bus accident to be probed, pilgrims' safety a priority: Guv
124.article_body: Uttarakhand Governor Gurmit Singh said on Monday that reason behind the bus accident near Damta, which claimed 26 lives, will be investigated, reiterating that pilgrims' safety is the state government's priority. "Lesson(s) will be taken from the accident...and a robust SOP will be prepared," Singh added. The bus, which fell into a gorge on Sunday evening, left four others injured.

125.title: UP Police releases pics of 40 suspects involved in Kanpur clashes, seeks info
125.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police has released photographs of 40 men in connection with the clashes and stone-pelting reported in Kanpur on Friday. Police suspect that these men played an active role in the violence, that left several injured. Police have put out a contact number and assured that the identity of those providing information regarding the individuals will be kept confidential.

126.title: 3 die, over 60 hospitalised after drinking contaminated water in K'taka
126.article_body: Three people died and at least 62 others, including 23 children, were admitted to hospital after allegedly drinking contaminated water over the last week in Raichur town of Karnataka. CM Basavaraj Bommai has announced ₹5-lakh aid for the families of the deceased. As per local health officials, the pipe supplying water is suspected to have been linked with drain water.

127.title: PIL seeking CBI probe into KK's death filed in Calcutta High Court
127.article_body: A Public Interest Litigation (PIL) has been filed in Calcutta High Court seeking a probe by CBI into late singer KK's demise. A second PIL has also been filed in the court demanding further investigation of the death by an independent agency alleging mismanagement at his final concert. KK passed away aged 53 following a live performance on May 31.

128.title: 7-yr-old girl injured during shooting practice in camp in Thane
128.article_body: Five people, including two National Cadet Corps (NCC) personnel, were booked after a 7-year-old girl was injured in an accidental firing incident during a training camp in Thane district, the police said on Sunday. The incident took place during firing practice at the camp. The girl has been admitted to Mumbai's JJ Hospital in a serious condition, an official said.

129.title: Need to make Indian banks, currency important part of international trade: PM
129.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said it is necessary to focus on how to make our domestic banks and currency an important part of the international supply chain and trade. PM Modi inaugurated the 'Iconic Week Celebrations' by the Ministry of Finance and Corporate Affairs as part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav'.

130.title: Hindi is language of underdeveloped states, will make us 'Shudras': TN MP
130.article_body: Tamil Nadu MP TKS Elangovan has alleged that attempts were being made to "impose Manu dharma through the imposition of Hindi", adding that Hindi is the language of underdeveloped states. "What will Hindi do? Only make us Shudras. It will do no benefit to us," he added. Several leaders criticised the DMK leader over his remarks.

131.title: Stones pelted between 2 groups after biker accidentally hits man in Agra
131.article_body: Clashes between two communities erupted in Uttar Pradesh's Agra after a bike rider slipped on an under-construction road and accidentally hit a passerby in Tajganj, police said. An argument took place between the two persons, which escalated to stone-pelting between local groups, police added. "A heavy police force was deployed and the situation was brought under control," Agra SSP said.

132.title: Who is Angelo Moriondo, 'godfather of espresso machines' honoured by Google?
132.article_body: Google Doodle on Monday paid tribute to Angelo Moriondo, the 'godfather of espresso machines', on his 171st birthday. The Italian inventor is credited for patenting the first known espresso machine in 1884. Moriondo's machine consisted of a large boiler that pushed heated water through coffee grounds, with a second boiler producing steam to flash the coffee and complete the brew.

133.title: Film on India's Recycle Man Binish Desai in the works
133.article_body: A film on the life of environmentalist Dr Binish Desai, known as the 'Recycle Man of India', is under development. "[It'll] be...world's first mainstream Bollywood movie which will revolve around a change maker's journey working towards eliminating the idea of waste," Desai said. The biopic will aim at promoting sustainability with a carbon-negative approach throughout its making, makers said.

134.title: Why no arrest has been made yet?: Owaisi over Nupur Sharma's remarks
134.article_body: Following Nupur Sharma’s controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi asked, "Why there is still no arrest against the spokesperson (now suspended)?" He added that instant action is taken when someone speaks or tweets against PM Narendra Modi but no action has been taken against Sharma who "insulted Prophet Muhammad".

135.title: Cong worker out on bail in 2 murder cases shoots wife dead in MP
135.article_body: A Congress party worker who is currently on bail in two murder cases, including that of his sister, allegedly shot his wife to death in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior on Sunday, police said. The accused, identified as Rishabh Bhadoriya, allegedly killed his wife in front of their children on suspicion of infidelity. Bhadoriya is currently absconding, police added.

136.title: Russia plans to restart telescope Germany shut over Ukraine war
136.article_body: Russia's space agency head Dmitry Rogozin has said that he's given instructions for restarting German telescope eROSITA "despite Germany's demand" that it should be shut down. Earlier, a German institute shut the telescope in protest over the Ukraine war. People "don't have a moral right to halt this research...just because their pro-fascist views are close to our enemies", he claimed.

137.title: We need to give our youth arms training: Akal Takht Jathedar
137.article_body: Akal Takht Jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh while addressing people on Operation Bluestar anniversary on Monday said, "We need to...give [our youth] arms training." He also called on Sikh organisations to encourage youth in Punjab to do so. Moreover, he objected to churches in the state's villages and added, "Sikh preachers must come out of...AC rooms...It's time to go to villages."

138.title: 5 booked for making casteist remarks against doctor in UP
138.article_body: Police have booked five people, including two doctors, for hurling casteist remarks at a doctor in Pratapgarh Medical College, Uttar Pradesh. In his complaint, Dr Sachin Pasi alleged that Dr Jai Prakash Verma hurled casteist remarks against him when the former opposed Verma for taking patients to his private clinic. Notably, four others were booked for supporting the casteist remarks.

139.title: Nadal's 14th French Open, 22nd Slam win at 36 is incredible: Tendulkar
139.article_body: Congratulating Rafael Nadal following his 14th French Open win, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "To go out there and win a record 14th French Open and 22nd Grand Slam at the age of 36 is an incredible achievement." Shoaib Malik said, "Mate you defy the odds every-time, age really is just a number for you! Keep going strong, champion."

140.title: BJP leaders trained in 'hate politics' by PM Modi: AAP's Sanjay Singh
140.article_body: AAP leader Sanjay Singh said in 75 years, no one has "bowed India's head in shame" as much as PM Narendra Modi. "BJP leaders and spokespersons make mistakes because they're trained in hate politics by PM Modi and the whole country bears the consequences," Singh added. His remarks came a day after BJP suspended its national spokesperson Nupur Sharma.

141.title: IAF aircraft to transport bodies of those killed in U'khand bus mishap to MP
141.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that Indian Air Force (IAF) aircraft has been arranged to transport the bodies of pilgrims killed in the bus accident in Uttarakhand to Madhya Pradesh. Chouhan said that the bodies will be sent to MP's Khajuraho after postmortem. "Our teams will be ready...and will take...the bodies to four different villages," he added.

142.title: Video shows Radhika Merchant's dance at event hosted by Mukesh & Nita Ambani
142.article_body: Videos of Anant Ambani's fiancee Radhika Merchant's Arangetram dance performance on Sunday have been shared online. Merchant was seen performing her debut Bharatanatyam dance after finishing her formal training during an event hosted by Anant's parents Mukesh and Nita Ambani at Jio World Centre in Mumbai. Actors Salman Khan, Aamir Khan and Ranveer Singh also attended the performance.

143.title: He's taken right method, but format is wrong: RP Singh on Kohli's form
143.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has said Virat Kohli is taking time to come back to his form because he's playing more T20 cricket where the scope of consuming deliveries is less. "You can start by scoring 60(55)...you can't expect to score 100(55)," Singh added. "Kohli has taken the right method but the format is wrong," he further said.

144.title: He is recovering at home: Bobby on rumours of Dharmendra being critical in hospital
144.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol has refuted rumours that his father, veteran actor Dharmendra, is critical in a hospital. "He is absolutely fine. He is at home and he is recovering. He is doing well. Thank you so much for your love and affection," Bobby said. Dharmendra was hospitalised last month following a muscle spasm.

145.title: Atmosphere of threat being propagated in state: Pilot on Moosewala’s death
145.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Monday met late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala’s family in Mansa. "It's tragic how our leader was killed. An atmosphere of threat is being propagated in state repetitively," Pilot said. "The Centre and state government should probe it (death) and take strict action," he stated. "Such an incident happened to instil fear in people," Pilot added.

146.title: Bangkok celebrates its 1st LGBTQ+ Pride march in 16 years
146.article_body: Bangkok on Sunday marked its first LGBTQ+ Pride march in the last 16 years. The event, named 'Naruemit Pride 2022' was held with support from Governor of Bangkok Chadchart Sittipunt and witnessed participation from thousands of people, who waved rainbow flags on the streets. Two bills on LGBTQ+ unions are waiting to go to the parliament in Thailand, Reuters reported.

147.title: ED raids on Satyendra Jain are an act of torture: Sanjay Singh
147.article_body: AAP MP Sanjay Singh has criticised the Enforcement Directorate raids at Delhi Health Minister Satyendra Jain's residence. "This is an act of torture, not an act of raid because Jain has been questioned for five days. He is an honest person," Singh said. "Whatever Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal said today is the training of the BJP itself," he added.

148.title: Lalu to go abroad for kidney transplant, requests court to release passport
148.article_body: RJD chief and former Bihar CM Lalu Prasad Yadav has filed an application at a special CBI court in Ranchi, seeking the release of his passport for renewal as he has to go abroad for a kidney transplant. Yadav's lawyer said, most likely, the former will go to Singapore. "Process for an appointment with the doctor...is underway," the lawyer added.

149.title: Suspension not enough, send them to jail: Mayawati after BJP expels members
149.article_body: A day after BJP members Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal were suspended over remarks hurting religious sentiments, BSP chief Mayawati called for their arrest. "Only suspension is not enough, they must be jailed under strict laws," she wrote on Twitter. She said that objectionable language should not be used against any religion and the BJP must rein in its members.

150.title: I had auditioned for 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi': Ayushmann
150.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana revealed in an interview that he had auditioned for a role in 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi'. "Actually, I made it as an RJ by the time I auditioned for the show. So I told...casting director 'Bro, I'm going'. So I couldn't do that...show," he added. Ayushmann further said the role eventually went to Pulkit Samrat.

151.title: BMC plans to rebuild old bridges in Mumbai's eastern suburbs
151.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) plans to reconstruct old bridges and widen new ones in Mumbai's eastern suburbs. The project is estimated to cost ₹51.17 crore and expected to be completed in 18 months, excluding the monsoon. "The process of appointing a contractor for executing the work has also been initiated," a BMC official said.

152.title: Man kills self in Gurugram hotel; 5-page suicide note blames wife, her family
152.article_body: A 31-year-old man died by suicide in a hotel room in Gurugram. Police said a five-page suicide note has been recovered from the man. Police added that in the suicide note, the man accused his wife and her family of harassing him and threatening to file a case against him. The victim's brother said he was under lot of stress.

153.title: Migrants from Delhi main reason behind Nagpur's COVID-19 surge: Minister
153.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, state minister Nitin Raut said, "Main reason behind rising coronavirus cases in Nagpur is migrants coming from Delhi." Raut claimed most of the 35 cases traced on Monday are from Delhi. "I feel we should do [contact] tracing at airport itself and make maximum efforts for testing in urban and rural areas," he added.

154.title: Actresses have reached out to me to praise my work, it's motivating: Kiara
154.article_body: Kiara Advani revealed that whenever she likes any contemporary's performance in a film, she gets her number to praise her performance even if she doesn't know her personally. "That's happened with me as well, when other actresses have reached out to me, even those I don't know, to tell me how much they enjoyed my work...It's so motivating," she added.

155.title: Not followed Waqar; my idols include Bumrah, Shami & Bhuvneshwar: Umran
155.article_body: Fast bowler Umran Malik said he has not followed ex-Pakistan pacer Waqar Younis. "I have a natural action. My idols include (Jasprit) Bumrah, (Mohammed) Shami and Bhuvneshwar (Kumar)," he added. "I used to follow them when I was playing while coming through the ranks," he stated. Umran was named in Team India squad for the T20I series against South Africa.

156.title: 18-year-old Coco jumps to career-best 13th, Nadal moves to 4th in rankings
156.article_body: American tennis player Coco Gauff has jumped 10 spots to be ranked 13th, her career-best in the WTA rankings. Coco entered her maiden Grand Slam final in the recently-concluded French Open, where she lost the final to Iga Swiatek. Meanwhile, Rafael Nadal, who won the men's singles French Open title, moved one spot to be ranked fourth.

157.title: Maha schools to reopen on June 15; masks not mandatory: Minister
157.article_body: Schools in Maharashtra will reopen on June 15 with COVID-19-appropriate measures regardless of the rising cases, state School Education Minister Varsha Gaikwad said on Monday. She said masks are not mandatory and new SOPs will be issued to schools. Further decisions will be taken in accordance with the situation, she added.

158.title: Delving into new character is like being a tourist in new country: Rogowski
158.article_body: German actor Franz Rogowski has said delving into a new character is like being a tourist in a new country. "In...beginning, you start taking pictures of...place you're visiting. Then, you go to restaurants, " he said, adding, "After a couple of days, you start looking at...narrow lanes and dusty market areas. Bit by bit, you start having real experiences."

159.title: Lavrov forced to cancel Serbia visit as 3 countries close airspace
159.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov was forced to cancel his visit to Serbia after three of the latter country's neighbours, Bulgaria, North Macedonia and Montenegro, closed their airspace to the aircraft carrying the minister. A ministry spokesperson confirmed the news during a broadcast on a TV channel, Russian news agency TASS reported. Earlier, Serbia secured a gas deal with Russia.

160.title: Expecting bit of spin, but pitch not dry square: Finch on Lankan surfaces
160.article_body: Australian skipper Aaron Finch has commented on the type of pitches that will be on offer on their tour to Sri Lanka which starts from Tuesday. "Expecting there to be a bit of spin there but it might be tacky...It's not a dry square," Finch said. He added, "There will be a lot of sun over the next 24 hours."

161.title: Should be in Limca Book of Records: Sule over raids on 'Deshmukh family'
161.article_body: Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik and ex-Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh have not done anything but are "stuck" in jail, NCP MP Supriya Sule said. "109 times raid on Deshmukh family should make it to Limca Book of Records," Sule added. "Today or tomorrow, the court will give them a clean chit. Whoever speaks against the Centre is raided," Sule stated.

162.title: Rahul Gandhi to meet Moosewala's family in Mansa on Tuesday
162.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will meet the late singer Sidhu Moosewala's family in the latter's native village in Punjab's Mansa district on Tuesday. Notably, this will be Gandhi's first meeting with the family since Moosewala's assassination. Gandhi had condoled on the demise of the 28-year-old singer-turned politician who was shot dead by assailants last month.

163.title: Rohit Shetty starts shooting for 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12', shares video
163.article_body: Rohit Shetty has started shooting for the stunt-based reality show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12' in Cape Town, South Africa. The filmmaker, who hosts the show, took to Instagram on Monday to share a video where he is seen in a helicopter. "Time to go crazy, wild...and real once again! Khatron Ke Khiladi!! Shoot begins," Rohit wrote while sharing the video.

164.title: 8 suspected sharp shooters who killed Sidhu Moosewala identified, pics released
164.article_body: Punjab Police have identified the eight suspected sharp shooters who allegedly killed singer Sidhu Moosewala. They belong to Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan and Maharashtra. They are Manpreet Singh Mannu, Jagroop Singh Roopa and Harkamal alias Ranu from Punjab, Priyavrat Fauji and Manjeet alias Bholu from Haryana, Saurav Mahakal and Santosh Jadhav from Pune and Subhash Banuda from Rajasthan.

165.title: Video of Joe Root's bat standing on its own goes viral, fan says 'What is this sorcery?'
165.article_body: A video of ex-England captain Joe Root's bat standing on its own when the batter was at the non-striker's end has gone viral on social media. Reacting to the video, a fan tweeted, "I knew @root66 was talented but not as magic as this...What is this sorcery?" Another fan wrote, "His bat is unusually square & flat at the bottom."

166.title: Layer'r Shot apologises for controversial ads accused of promoting rape culture
166.article_body: Layer'r Shot has apologised after facing criticism over its advertisements, which were accused of promoting rape culture. "We never intended to hurt anyone’s sentiments...or outrage any woman’s modesty, or promote any sort of culture, as wrongly perceived by some," it said. "We...apologise for...advertisements that consequentially caused rage amongst individuals and several communities."

167.title: Delhi Police books unknown persons for sending death threats to Nupur Sharma
167.article_body: Delhi Police has registered an FIR against unknown persons for allegedly threatening and harassing former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma over her alleged remarks on Prophet Muhammad during a television debate last month. "We have started an investigation and are looking into tweets and comments posted by unknown persons on Sharma's video," an officer said.

168.title: Rafael Nadal refuses retirement rumours, says 'I will keep fighting'
168.article_body: After winning his 22nd Grand Slam, Spanish tennis player Rafael Nadal denied the rumours about his retirement. "I don't know what can happen in the future. I will keep fighting to try to keep going," the 36-year-old said after winning his 14th French Open title. Nadal defeated Casper Ruud 6-3, 6-3, 6-0 in the French Open final.

169.title: Barring injury, Root will go miles past my record: Alastair Cook
169.article_body: Ex-England captain Alastair Cook, who's the highest run-scorer for England in Test cricket, has said that Joe Root will go miles past his record. "For the most complete batsmen in all three forms, it's Root. His consistency is incredible," added Cook. Root crossed the 10,000-run mark in their win against New Zealand in the first match of the three-Test series.

170.title: 15 Twitter, FB accounts booked over communal clashes in Kanpur
170.article_body: The police have booked 15 social media accounts on Twitter and Facebook for allegedly inciting people in connection to the communal clashes in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. The violence, in which about 40 people were injured, had broken out following former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad. Earlier, 36 people were arrested following the violence.

171.title: Russian general killed in eastern Ukraine: Report
171.article_body: A Russian state media journalist on Sunday said that a Russian general was killed in eastern Ukraine. However, the report didn't say precisely when and where Major General Roman Kutuzov was killed. Notably, Russia already classifies military deaths as state secrets even in times of peace and hasn't updated its official casualty figures in Ukraine since March 25.

172.title: Calendar Grand Slam will motivate Nadal to keep going: Henman
172.article_body: Tim Henman said the chance to complete the Calendar Grand Slam will motivate Rafael Nadal to play at Wimbledon and beyond. Earlier, Nadal said he'd play at Wimbledon only if his body allowed it. Nadal has won first two Grand Slams of the year for the first time in his career following his record-extending 14th French Open title on Sunday.

173.title: Pune adequately prepared if COVID-19 cases rise: PMC health chief
173.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation's Health Department chief Dr Ashish Bharati said the civic body is adequately prepared if COVID-19 cases rise. "There are at least 800-900 beds across PMC-run hospitals…Around 1,000-1,200 tests are being conducted daily in the city as the number of new cases has gone up slightly," he added. Maharashtra reported over 1,400 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday.

174.title: Man impersonates police to rob senior citizens in Hyd, nabbed
174.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police nabbed an auto driver who'd impersonated a police officer to carry out theft on Saturday. The accused, identified as Ramavath Naresh, would reportedly 'summon' senior citizens to the police station after threatening them with false cases and rob them once they boarded his auto. Police seized materials worth ₹80,000, including gold ornaments, from Naresh's possession.

175.title: Delhi Police to reward 2 Army aspirants for chasing down thieves escaping in auto
175.article_body: Two Army aspirants chased down mobile phone snatchers who were trying to escape in an autorickshaw and managed to recover the device after a fight.
