"We are aware that some businesses are abusing our anti-spam policies to send promotional messages to users in India," Google said. RCS allows verified businesses to send messages, which include images and interactive features, to customers.

351.title: I'm not comfortable doing extremely bold scenes: Erica Fernandes
351.article_body: Actress Erica Fernandes said she isn't comfortable doing extremely bold scenes. "Some people are comfortable doing such scenes. But I am not. It matters to me to do things that I am comfortable with," she added. "Every second project that's coming my way or being made is mainly focused on the intimate part more than the story itself," she said.

352.title: 2 women, 4 minors beat disabled man to death in Mumbai
352.article_body: The police on Friday arrested two women and detained four minors on charges of killing a 51-year-old disabled man in Mumbai's Chembur. All six are accused of assaulting Prakash Waghmare with bamboo sticks on Thursday over his objection to his niece's relationship with one of the minors, according to the police. Waghmare had passed away at a hospital on Friday.

353.title: 400-year-old monastery destroyed in Russian attack, says Ukraine; releases video
353.article_body: A monastery that is around 400 years old has been destroyed in a Russian attack, Ukraine has said while releasing a video of the ancient building on fire. The 17th-century Svyatohirsk Lavra monastery is located near Russian positions in the eastern Donetsk region. It was first destroyed during the Soviet era and rebuilt later.

354.title: There's threat to my family: Nupur as her address is made public in BJP suspension letter
354.article_body: After being suspended from BJP amid controversy over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad, Nupur Sharma tweeted, "I request all media houses and everybody else not to make my address public. There is a security threat to my family." This comes after her suspension letter, which consisted of her address, was shared by various media houses and journalists.

355.title: When Arshdeep bowls at death, he keeps Dhoni and Hardik quiet: Irfan
355.article_body: Irfan Pathan has said pacer Arshdeep Singh was selected in India's 18-member squad for upcoming T20I series against South Africa due to his ability to keep the best batters "quiet". He added, "When he bowls at the death, he keeps MS Dhoni, Hardik Pandya quiet, bowls consistent yorkers against...set batters." Irfan further said that Arshdeep should play all five T20Is.

356.title: List of country-wise monkeypox cases released by WHO
356.article_body: The WHO has released the number of monkeypox cases reported in 27 non-endemic countries between May 13 and June 2. With total cases in these countries rising to 780, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland have the highest number of cases at 207. This is followed by Spain (156), Portugal (138), Canada (58), Germany (57) and France (33).

357.title: What did you do about Delhi's law & order in last 10 days: Atishi asks L-G
357.article_body: AAP MLA Atishi has accused Delhi Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena of "interfering" in the Delhi government's work and "conspiring" to derail democracy. "Today I want to ask him 'What have you done to improve the law and order situation in Delhi in the last 10 days?'," Atishi added. "L-G is acting like a dummy of the...central government," she said.

358.title: There is peace in my life: Vicky Kaushal post marriage with Katrina
358.article_body: During his appearance at the IIFA awards, actor Vicky Kaushal said his married life with his wife, actress Katrina Kaif is going good. Speaking about his life post marriage, Vicky said, "Sukoon bhari hai (there is a lot of peace) in his life." He further added that he's missing Katrina at the award show.

359.title: We'll hit new targets: Putin in warning to West on missile supply to Ukraine
359.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned of striking "those targets which we haven't yet been hitting" if the West supplies Ukraine with longer-range missiles, amid the war. This came after the US announced plans to give Ukraine precision HIMARS rocket systems. Putin said the "fuss" around weapon supplies from the West to Ukraine was 'designed to drag the conflict out'.

360.title: Conduct survey of Karnataka's Srirangapatna mosque in 25 days: VHP
360.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) has asked authorities in Karnataka's Mandya to conduct a survey at the Jamia mosque in Srirangapatna in 25 days to find out whether it had been a temple. This comes after members of various Hindutva outfits tried to enter the mosque but were stopped by police. VHP said it wanted to pray at the mosque.

361.title: WHO lists 5 key actions to prevent monkeypox
361.article_body: Amid rising monkeypox cases, WHO listed five key actions to prevent the disease. It suggested raising awareness about monkeypox and equipping countries to be able to recognise it. The second step is stopping human-to-human transmission using public health tools. Third step is protecting frontline workers. The next actions are utilising countermeasures like antivirals and accelerating research.

362.title: Delhi witnessed 2,300 accidents in first 5 months of 2022
362.article_body: Delhi saw 2,300 accidents which led to 505 deaths in the first five months of 2022, official data showed. Of these, 495 were fatal accidents and 1,762 were simple accidents. Outer north district, at 56, recorded the highest district-wise deaths, followed by northwest (50) and southwest (46) districts. Shahdara (16) reported least number of deaths, followed by central district (19).

363.title: Lata Mangeshkar never presented herself as a great singer: Arijit
363.article_body: Singer Arijit Singh, remembering late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar, said, "She never presented herself as...great singer, she always sang like a commoner." "She used to sing complex songs with such ease that it's amazing," Arijit said, adding, "When you listen to...song it seems like it's such an easy song but when you try singing it...you realise how difficult it is."

364.title: Root smashes 26th ton, completes 10,000 Test runs as Eng beat NZ by 5 wickets
364.article_body: England's Joe Root smashed his 26th hundred and reached 10,000 runs in Test cricket as England defeated New Zealand by five wickets in the first Test at Lord's. Root has now become the 14th player in cricket history and second from England to complete 10,000 Test runs. Root remained unbeaten at 115(170) as England chased down New Zealand's 277-run target.

365.title: BMC launches doorstep drive to speed up vaccination rate in Mumbai
365.article_body: The BMC has launched a drive to speed up the COVID-19 vaccination rate in the 12-17 age group and to increase booster dose intake among senior citizens in Mumbai. The drive is a part of the national 'Har Ghar Dastak 2.0' campaign. Only 28% of those in the 12-14 age group have taken the first dose, according to BMC data.

366.title: Congress appoints observers for 3 states ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
366.article_body: Congress on Sunday appointed senior leaders Mallikarjun Kharge, Pawan Kumar Bansal, TS Singh Deo, Bhupesh Baghel and Rajeev Shukla as its central observers ahead of the Rajya Sabha polls.  Kharge has been appointed observer in Maharashtra, Bansal and Deo in Rajasthan and Baghel and Shukla in Haryana. These leaders will take the responsibility with immediate effect.

367.title: Rapper 50 Cent reshares Madonna's pics, compares her to aliens
367.article_body: Rapper 50 Cent reshared a picture shared by singer Madonna on social media along with a series of pictures of aliens. He wrote, "I hope she didn't make her kids take this picture. LOL at 63 somebody tell her to chill out please." In December, he had called her racy photos "the funniest sh*t" and later apologised for his comments.

368.title: Terence shares video of him dancing to KK's 'Such Keh...', says 'Gone too soon'
368.article_body: Choreographer Terence Lewis took to Instagram to pay tribute to KK, who passed away on May 31. He shared a video of himself dancing to Rehnaa Hai Terre Dil Mein's song 'Such Keh Raha Hai', which was sung by the late singer. "Gone Too Soon. KK you will live with us forever," Terence wrote with a broken heart emoji.

369.title: Maharashtra might be seeing 4th wave of COVID-19: Aaditya Thackeray
369.article_body: Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday said the state could be seeing the beginning of the fourth COVID-19 wave and urged citizens not to panic. "We're asking everyone to wear masks when stepping outdoors. We haven't made...masks mandatory, but will make it soon," he added. Aaditya appealed to the public to receive the booster dose of the vaccine on time.

370.title: I give a lot more money to climate change than Musk or anyone else: Gates
370.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates in an interview said that he gives "a lot more money" to climate change than the world's richest person Elon Musk "or anyone else". Musk recently claimed that Gates has a "multi-billion dollar short position" against Tesla. Reacting to the claim, Gates said, "Somebody shorting...(Tesla) stock doesn't slow him down or hurt him in any way."

371.title: BJP suspends Nupur Sharma after her remarks on Prophet Muhammad
371.article_body: BJP has suspended its national spokesperson Nupur Sharma from the party after her controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad during a TV debate. The party has also suspended Delhi BJP's media in-charge Naveen Kumar Jindal. Notably, violence broke out in Kanpur in Uttar Pradesh on Friday after a Muslim organisation gave a call to shut shops over remarks made by Sharma.

372.title: 150 cr vaali smile sochni padegi: Kartik as 'Bhool...' earns ₹149 cr
372.article_body: Kartik Aaryan on Sunday retweeted film trade analyst Taran Adarsh's post about the box office figures of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. As per Adarsh, the horror-comedy film has earned ₹149.11 crore in India so far. Kartik wrote, "Kal 150 crore vaali smile sochni padegi." He had earlier shared a picture of himself smiling after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' crossed the ₹100-crore mark.

373.title: It probably looked like I was freaking out: Gauff on French Open final loss
373.article_body: Following her loss in the first Grand Slam final of her career at French Open, 18-year-old Coco Gauff said, "It probably looked like I was freaking out." She added, "But really, it was just [that] Iga Swiatek was too good." World number one Swiatek defeated 18th seed 6-1, 6-3 in one hour eight minutes on Saturday.

374.title: Bezos' Blue Origin flies 6 tourists to space in 5th crewed mission
374.article_body: Billionaire Jeff Bezos' space tourism venture Blue Origin completed its fifth crewed launch on Saturday after it flew six tourists into space for a 10-minute ride. The crew included Katya Echazarreta, the youngest American woman in space, and Victor Correa Hespanha, the second Brazilian to go into space, among others. The flight touched an altitude of approximately 106 kilometres.

375.title: First batch of 145 Haj pilgrims from J&K leaves for Saudi Arabia
375.article_body: The first batch of 145 Kashmiri pilgrims left for Saudi Arabia to perform the annual Haj pilgrimage, officials said on Sunday. The annual Haj pilgrimage resumed this year after being suspended for two years in view of the COVID-19 pandemic. Around 6,000 pilgrims from the Union Territory are scheduled to undertake the pilgrimage this year, according to the officials.

376.title: BBMP Chief Commissioner plants sapling on World Environment Day
376.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath on Sunday shared pictures of him planting a sapling during World Environment Day celebrations. One of the pictures shows Nath watering the sapling. He said that during the celebrations, which were held at the Independence Park in the city, saplings were also distributed to the public.

377.title: Late singer KK's song 'Dhoop Paani Bahne De' to release on June 6
377.article_body: Director Srijit Mukerji announced that late singer KK's song 'Dhoop Paani Bahne De' from upcoming film 'Sherdil' will release on June 6. Srijit wrote on Twitter, "Had already shared a video of Gulzar Saab and KK from this recording. Never imagined in my wildest dreams the first song of Sherdil will be released in his absence. Travel well, my friend."

378.title: Ukraine plans to restart domestic football leagues from August
378.article_body: Ukraine's football federation president Andriy Pavelko has revealed that they are planning to resume domestic football leagues in the country from August. "I spoke with our president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, about how important football is to distract...At all levels we will start in August," stated Pavelko. All leagues were stopped when Russia launched the invasion of the country in February.

379.title: You've respected me as a sister: Kangana on CM Yogi Adityanath's 50th b'day
379.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut shared a post for UP CM Yogi Adityanath on his 50th birthday. Taking to Instagram Stories, Kangana shared a photo of him and wrote, "An eminent leader and a source of inspiration. Someone who has always loved and respected me as a sister. Praying for Yogi's long life and [I] hope his glory shine throughout this world."

380.title: Want to teach school children once or twice a month: MP CM
380.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has expressed his desire to teach school children. He said, "We should...be ready to play the role of teacher. I also have a desire to visit school once or twice a month and teach children." The CM said this while inaugurating the Learnings from National Achievement Survey workshop at Kushabhau Thakre International Auditorium.

381.title: 8 students hospitalised after having midday meal in Kerala school
381.article_body: Eight students of a government upper primary school in Kerala's Alappuzha were hospitalised when they complained of uneasiness after having their midday meals. "We need to find out whether the food poisoning happened inside the school or not," a food safety official said. State Health Minister Veena George has asked the Food Safety Commissioner to look into the incident.

382.title: Biden plays song 'Butter' during BTS' White House visit; video surfaces
382.article_body: US President Joe Biden has shared a video of him playing South Korean band BTS' song 'Butter' during their visit to the White House on his social media handles. "I figured I'd make you feel at home," Biden said as he played the song. The K-pop group had met Biden last week to discuss the rise in anti-Asian hate crimes.

383.title: 3 kids out to play after lunch get trapped in car in Tamil Nadu, die
383.article_body: Three children aged seven, five and four died of suspected suffocation after they got trapped inside a car while they were playing after lunch on June 4. Reports said that the car's doors could only be opened from outside. The parents of the children found them lying unconscious inside the car and broke into the vehicle with help from passersby.

384.title: Wildfire spreads near Greek capital; houses, cars damaged
384.article_body: Buoyed by intense winds, a wildfire spread on the outskirts of the Greek capital Athens that damaged cars and houses, said the Fire Department. The authorities have ordered evacuation in parts of the Voula and Glyfada regions. More than 130 firefighters, six firefighting aircraft and four helicopters were deployed to control the fire.

385.title: Bhumi participates in a plantation drive in Nainital on World Environment Day
385.article_body: On the occasion of World Environment Day, Bhumi Pednekar planted saplings in Nainital, where she's shooting for her film 'The Ladykiller'. The actress, along with some children from NGO 'SOS Children's Villages of India', also planted saplings in pots that were painted by the children. "This planet is our only home...If we don't keep...[it] safe...we'll not be safe," Bhumi said.

386.title: When I entered stadium, it felt different: CSK's Simarjeet Singh on IPL debut
386.article_body: CSK pacer Simarjeet Singh, who made his IPL debut this season, has revealed that he was "extremely nervous" in his first game against SRH. "When I entered the stadium for the first time, it felt super different," he added. On playing under CSK captain MS Dhoni, Simarjeet said, "I learned how to be calm in pressure situations from Dhoni."

387.title: You did it: Lewandowski to Swiatek after her French Open title win
387.article_body: Taking to Instagram, footballer Robert Lewandowski congratulated Polish Tennis player Iga Swiatek after she won the French Open 2022. "What a match! Congratulations Swiatek, you did it," he wrote. Lewandowski attended the French Open final between Swiatek and Coco Gauff. "Lewandowski's been a top athlete in our country...it's hard to believe that he actually came to watch me," Swiatek stated.

388.title: Tunisian judges to strike for a week after Prez sacks 57 judges
388.article_body: Tunisian judges will hold a week-long strike from Monday and a sit-in protest after the country's President Kais Saied dismissed 57 judges over charges of corruption and protecting terrorists last week. Earlier in February, Saied had also dissolved the Supreme Judicial Council. "The attack was not only against judges, but on the law and freedoms," a judges' association head said.

389.title: RBI may use pics of Rabindranath Tagore, APJ Abdul Kalam on banknotes: Report
389.article_body: In a first, the Finance Ministry and the RBI are considering using watermark figures of Rabindranath Tagore and APJ Abdul Kalam on a new series of banknotes, as per a report. It added that two separate sets of Gandhi, Tagore and Kalam watermarks have been sent to IIT-Delhi Emeritus Professor Dilip T Shahani before a final presentation to the Centre.

390.title: Will summons in name of Nehru be pasted on his memorial?: Shiv Sena
390.article_body: After ED summoned Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece 'Saamana' asked, "Will a few summons in the name of Nehru be pasted on his memorial?" "In the National Herald case, the transaction was done to repay the loan and not for misconduct...Nehru started this newspaper in the year 1937," Shiv Sena added.

391.title: Man says 'local guy' plans to kill brother, shares video, Hyd Police respond
391.article_body: A Twitter user shared video of a man indulging in violence and said he is a "local guy" who has plans to kill the user's brother. He also shared screenshot of mail sent to Hyderabad Police officer regarding the matter. "We are suffering, please help us," the user wrote. Hyderabad Police tagged SHO Chaderghat and SHO Malakpet in their reply.

392.title: India's trade deficit widens to $23.33 bn in May, exports rise 15%
392.article_body: India's trade deficit widened to $23.33 billion in May 2022, compared with $6.53 billion recorded in May 2021, as imports grew faster than exports. Merchandise exports rose 15.46% to $37.29 billion while imports grew 56.14% to $60.62 billion. While petroleum and crude oil imports rose 91.6% to $18.14 billion, coal imports rose to $5.33 billion in May 2022.

393.title: This was the first time I did intimate scene in any show: Anuritta on Aashram 3
393.article_body: Actress Anuritta K spoke about the pressure due to her show Ek Badnaam Aashram 3's popularity. "This was the first time I did an intimate scene in any...series," she said. "I feel once the series is popular and your character has received so much love, the responsibility increases. Prakash Jha sir was...clear what he wanted out of me," she added.

394.title: Salman Khan meets world's smallest singer, hugs him in viral video
394.article_body: The world's smallest singer Abdu Rozik posted a video on social media of meeting actor Salman Khan and singing 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha' for him. Abdu wrote alongside the video, "Jab Salman ko deka to esa laga jese apna koyee (When I saw Salman, it felt like someone my own)." Salman can be seen hugging Abdu in the viral video.

395.title: Australia says Chinese aircraft flew dangerously close to its own
395.article_body: Australia has accused a Chinese fighter aircraft of flying dangerously close to its plane during a routine surveillance activity in May. "The intercept resulted in a dangerous manoeuvre which posed a safety threat," said the government. Defence Minister Richard Marles said that the Chinese jet released a "bundle of chaff" containing aluminium pieces that went into the Australian aircraft's engine.

396.title: Documents link Kanpur violence mastermind with radical groups: Police
396.article_body: Police have come across documents linking the alleged mastermind of the Kanpur violence with radical groups, as per senior police officials. The documents were found with the key accused, including Zafar Hayat Hashmi, when they were arrested. Several people, including policemen, were injured in the clash on Friday.

397.title: 3 killed, 11 injured as multiple gunmen open fire on crowd in US' Philadelphia
397.article_body: Three people were killed and 11 were injured after multiple shooters opened fire into a crowd on a popular Philadelphia street, police said. Police officers were patrolling South Street, an area with many restaurants and bars, when "they observed several active shooters shooting into the crowd," Inspector D.F. Pace of the Philadelphia Police Department said.

398.title: I was sexually abused by family friend for 2.5 years as a teen, says Kubbra Sait
398.article_body: Actress Kubbra Sait has revealed in her memoir that she was sexually abused by a friend of her parents when she was 17 years old. "I was being sexually abused and no one in my close perimeter could even tell," Sait wrote. She referred to her abuser as 'X' and said the abuse went on for two-and-a-half years.

399.title: 2019 WC final scene recreated as ball deflects off Stokes' bat in Lord's Test, video viral
399.article_body: A video went viral showing the ball deflecting off Ben Stokes' bat at non-striker's end in Lord's Test against New Zealand, with Joe Root imitating Stokes' hands-up reaction from the 2019 World Cup final. Notably, during the 2019 World Cup final, a throw had deflected off Stokes' bat and raced towards boundary when England needed nine runs to win.

400.title: Lego 'freezes' ops in some Russian stores after supply gets hit due to sanctions
400.article_body: Toymaker Lego's Russian reseller has said it is temporarily "freezing" operations at some of its stores in the country after the sanctions imposed on Moscow impacted its supply network. In March, Lego paused shipments to Russia due to disruptions caused by the Ukraine war. The company has 81 stores in Russia, which are operated by Inventive Retail Group.

401.title: Took me 8yrs to get my first Best Actress award: Kriti on IIFA win
401.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon celebrated her IIFA Best Actress award by posting a series of pictures on Instagram, writing, "Dreams do come true...It's taken me 8yrs to get my first #BestActress award." Kriti won the award for 2021 film 'Mimi'. She further wrote, "Will always be grateful to Dinesh Vijan [and] Laxman Utekar sir for making me your Mimi for life."

402.title: We still back ourselves to take 10 wickets vs England: NZ's Daryl
402.article_body: New Zealand all-rounder Daryl Mitchell, speaking about the ongoing Test match against England, has said, "We still back ourselves to take 10 wickets." "We'll show up tomorrow morning now with the chance to open up an end and get stuck into their bowlers," he stated. Ahead of Day 4, England need 61 runs to win the match.

403.title: 'Vikram' becomes Kamal Haasan's third film to cross ₹100-crore earnings worldwide
403.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' has crossed the ₹100-crore mark globally within two days of its release. It has become the third film to cross the ₹100-crore mark globally in Haasan's career after 'Dasavatharam' and 'Vishwaroopam'. The film, which also stars Vijay Sethupathi, Fahadh Faasil and Suriya, has been directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj.
